thread.title: Gary Crowton resigns as offensive coordinator
thread.title_full: Gary Crowton resigns as SUU offensive coordinator | Deseret News

author: Carter Williams
title: Gary Crowton resigns as offensive coordinator
text:
Gary Crowton, one-time BYU head coach and NFL assistant coach, stepped down from his current post as SUU Monday afternoon, citing personal reasons.
More Coverage SUU football: Trio of projected NFL draft picks, Thunderbirds on 3-0 winning streak Gary Crowton, one-time BYU head coach and NFL assistant coach, has stepped down from his current post as SUU Monday afternoon, citing personal reasons.
Crowton will be reassigned as a special advisor to Jason Butikofer, who took over as SUU's athletic director in August, the university released in a statement.
"At this time I feel like it is important for me to step away from the SUU football program because of personal reasons," Crowton released in a statement. "I wish the team and (SUU head coach Ed Lamb) the very best. I appreciate this university and I have really enjoyed my association with the football program. The timing is unfortunate, but I have some issues that need to be dealt with at this time."
Lamb was unavailable for comment and will address the situation at SUU's weekly media availability on Tuesday.
SUU is 3-2 and 2-0 in Big Sky Conference play this season, following a 44-0 win over in-state rival Weber State on Saturday. The Thunderbirds have outscored opponents 129-10 in their recent three-game winning streak.
Crowton served as BYU football's head coach from 2001 to 2004. He also has served as an for Oregon, Maryland and LSU, as well as the Chicago Bears in the NFL and Winnipeg in the CFL. He took over as SUU's in 2014.
The T-Birds have a bye this week and return to action on Oct. 17 against Sacramento State. Lamb said assistant and wide receivers coach Justin Walterscheid will take over as SUU's Crowton's responsibilities.
